text: I Exception Hierarchy v . TR e The top class is java.lang.Throwable e Only instances of Throwable can be parameter of a catch block or be thrown E = = e Checked exceptions are throwables that are not RuntimeException, Error or any of their subclasses BV E=>m=â€”- o These must be handled (and that is checked by the compiler) o Eg., IOException e |tis unlikely that the program can recover if an Error is thrown (e.g., java.lang.Out OfMemoryError). o Changes to the code or specifications must be done by the programmer
